intro: Rhexia alifanus, commonly known as the Florida sand-verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its erect stem and clusters of small, showy pink or red flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in sandy or well-drained soils, often in open woodlands or pine flatwoods. Its leaves are opposite and lance-shaped, with a rough texture. Rhexia alifanus is adapted to full sun and is often found in disturbed or dry habitats.
